article_title: Bank of Japan's Kuroda Signals Impatience With Abe Government
article_text:
TOKYO—Japan's central-bank chief predicted victory in his battle to root out the deflation that has long sapped economic vitality in the world's third-largest economy, but expressed impatience with the government's pace in cutting red tape and encouraging businesses to invest more.

"Implementation is key, and implementation should be swift," Bank of Japan Gov. Haruhiko Kuroda said in an interview with The Wall Street...

twitter.description: In an exclusive interview, the Bank of Japan chief said he doesn't expect the yen to rise further, but expressed impatience with the government's pace in cutting red tape and encouraging business investment.
twitter.creator: @gerardtbaker

image.alt: BOJ's Kuroda signals impatience with Abe government.
